title: Terrorist killed in anti-terror operation in J&K’s Kulgam
content: This is the third encounter in J&K this week; six terrorists were left killed in these encounters, including all the three involved in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Share of AC berths doubled in last decade in long-distance Indian trains

title: Bombay HC gets 4th Bench at Kolhapur; sittings from August 18; Maharashtra CM hails move
content: The new Bench is likely to have jurisdiction over six districts — Satara, Sangli, Solapur, Kolhapur, Ratnagiri and Sindhudurg (last two located in coastal Konkan region)

title: BRS conducts preparatory meeting ahead of August 8 public meeting to amplify voices of BCs
content: BRS MLC and Leader of the Opposition in Legislative Council S. Madhusudhan Chary has called upon party functionaries to make the August 8 public meeting a grand success

title: After Prada controversy, LIDCOM and LIDKAR reaffirm ownership of Kolhapuri Chappal GI Tag
content: After a Maharashtra business body engages in discussion with Prada, LIDCOM and LIDKAR say that nobody apart from them can negotiate with Prada or anyone else

title: No resumption of MGNREGA work in West Bengal despite HC order says PBKMS
content: Alleging willful inaction by both the governments, the Paschim Banga Khet Majoor Samity demanded the immediate implementation of MGNREGA work in West Bengal, as per the High Court order. Hearing a petition of the agricultural workers union the Calcutta High Court had directed resumption of MGNREGA in the state from August 1

title: Many MBBS seats remain vacant in country, says Union Minister Anupriya Patel
content: While the government has increased the seats by 39% in the last five years, vacancies persist, underscoring concerns around access, affordability, and distribution of institutions

title: Jagan attempting to incite violence, destabilise State: Atchannaidu
content: The Minister alleged that Mr. Jagan Mohan Reddy was spreading misinformation and backing individuals accused of corruption and indecency

title: CPI(M) calls for protest on August 5 against ‘true-up charges’ burden
content: An additional ₹12,771 crore power tariff burden is sought to be imposed on the consumers, it alleges, and demands its immediate withdrawal

title: NIA makes second consecutive arrest in 2024 Jiribam killings case
content: The accused has been identified as Lalrosang Hmar aka Rosang, of Moinathol village in Assam’s Dilkhosh Grant Cachar

title: This Independence Day, J&K Govt to distribute 15 lakh flags, set up portal for real-time monitoring of events
content: To enhance public involvement, markets and public areas will be decorated, and the distribution of National Flags will be facilitated primarily through Self Help Groups

title: Dharmasthala exhumations day 4: no remains found
content: SIT found partial skeletal remains when they dug up spot 6, the only place they have recovered remains

title: Communal tensions triggers in Pune’s Yavat village, one detained
content: The police deployed SRPF and additional police forces to maintain law and order. During the chaos, the two-wheelers and four-wheelers were vandalised

title: Telangana’s surrogacy scam: The business of selling babies
content: In August 2024, a couple from Rajasthan travelled to Secunderabad for an IVF procedure. A doctor at a clinic they approached convinced them to opt for surrogacy instead. After paying ₹30 lakh and getting a baby a year later, the couple realised through DNA testing that the child was not theirs. Serish Nanisetti and Siddharth Kumar Singh report on the surrogacy scam in Telangana

title: Congress shouldn’t allow BJP to usurp saffron colour, says Prithviraj Chavan amid ‘saffron terror’ charges
content: Chavan says that the govt should appeal against Malegaon order and 7/11 train blasts judgement, so there is justice for the victims

title: Odisha govt. tightens norms for hiring external consultants
content: The capability of in-house employees remains grossly underutilized while dependency on consultants has increased, government says

title: After 7 years, red panda cubs born in Sikkim zoo
content: The captive red panda population at the Himalayan Zoological Park near Gangtok was nearly decimated by two outbreaks of canine distemper, a highly contagious and potentially fatal viral disease

title: 2008 Malegaon case: Congress attempted to fabricate “saffron terror” narrative to humiliate Hindus and for vote-bank politics, says BJP
content: Former ATS officer Mehboob Mujawar has claim that pressure was exerted on him to arrest Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat

title: Afghan man arrested in Jabalpur for ‘illegally’ obtaining Indian passport, running racket; two others held too
content: Apart from having obtained his own passport using fake documents, the accused was also getting Indian passports made for his Afghan friends living in West Bengal and Chhattisgarh

title: Trinamool highlights unnatural death migrant worker in Pune, blames it on targeting of Bengali speakers
content: The deceased worker was identified as Dipu Das (28), a resident of Binnaguri panchayat area of Rajganj of West Bengal’s Jalpaiguri  district. The family members of the migrant worker claimed that he was murdered

title: Five get life term for 2018 Bulandshahr violence
content: Judgment comes more than six years after a police inspector and a local resident died in violence that erupted in a U.P. village over rumours of cow slaughter

title: Kerala, Chhattisgarh units of BJP at odds over nuns’ arrest; will get ‘justice’, insists Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: Amid protests by the Christian community and political parties in Kerala demanding release of the nuns, the State unit continued its effort to mend bridges with Church leaders.

title: Can OPS succeed where other AIADMK leaders who joined DMK failed?
content: There has been a long-standing trend of AIADMK leaders failing to make a mark in the elections after aligning themselves with the DMK

title: Tamil Nadu’s engine of progress: education for all
content: As we proudly send off another batch of students from the most disadvantaged backgrounds to the most prestigious educational institutions in the country, we must look back at Tamil Nadu’s legacy in pushing to make education accessible to all; the success stories are not isolated, they reflect a systemic change

title: Indian fuel exports escape Trump's tariff net, no Russian penalty yet
content: Earlier, the U.S. President had announced plans to impose a 25% tariff on India, along with an additional penalty, citing concerns over the country's energy and defence ties with Russia, as well as existing trade barriers

title: Terrorist Killed In Encounter In J&K, Army Says "Operation Akhal" Underway
content: Security forces launched a cordon and search operation in the forest area in the south Kashmir district's Akhal after receiving specific intelligence inputs about the presence of terrorists on Friday.

title: "In World's Oceans...": Russian Lawmaker On Trump Nuclear Submarine Move
content: There are enough Russian nuclear submarines in the high seas to tackle two American subs dispatched by US President Donald Trump to counter Russia, a member of the Russian Parliament Duma has said.

title: "Day Not Far When Himachal Pradesh May Vanish From Country's Map": Top Court
content: The Supreme Court has flagged the ecological imbalance in Himachal Pradesh and cautioned that the entire state may "vanish in thin air" if the situation does not change.

title: J&K Officer, Son Killed, Wife Injured In Reasi Landslide
content: A large boulder, part of a landslide, struck their vehicle, killing Rajinder Singh Rana, a Jammu and Kashmir Administrative Service officer, and his son on the spot.

title: "Good Step": Donald Trump On Reports Of India Halting Russian Oil Imports
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday said India has reportedly stopped purchasing Russian oil, calling it a "good step" if confirmed.

title: 6.2 Magnitude Quake Hits Russia's Kuril Islands Days After Massive Tremor
content: An Earthquake of magnitude 6.2 was recorded on the east of the Kuril Islands late on Friday, as reported by the National Centre for Seismology (NCS) on Saturday.

title: US Court Rules Elon Musk's X Must Face Lawsuit Over Child Pornography Video
content: A federal appeals court on Friday revived part of a lawsuit accusing Elon Musk's X of becoming a haven for child exploitation, though the court said the platform deserves broad immunity from claims over objectionable content.

title: AAP, BJP Play Blame Game Over Rising Dengue, Malaria Cases In Delhi
content: A blame game has started in Delhi between the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) and the BJP-led Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) on Friday over the rising cases of vector-borne diseases in the national capital.

title: Tesla Ordered To Pay $242 Million In 2019 Fatal Autopilot Crash
content: A Florida jury on Friday ordered Tesla to pay hundreds of millions of dollars to plaintiffs who blamed a deadly 2019 crash on the company's "Autopilot" driver assistance technology.

title: Jeffrey Epstein's Ex-Girlfriend Moved To Texas Prison After Trump Official Meeting
content: Ghislaine Maxwell, the accomplice of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, has been moved from a prison in Florida to a minimum security facility in Texas, the Bureau of Prisons said Friday, triggering an angry reaction from some of their victims.

title: 4 Killed In Shooting At Montana Bar In US
content: The ATF says multiple people have been shot at a Montana business, and authorities are searching for a suspect.

title: 30 Injured After Several Coaches Of Passenger Train Derail In Pakistan
content: According to the Pakistan Railways, the Islamabad Express that was going to Rawalpindi from Lahore derailed at Kala Shah Kaku, Sheikhupura, some 50 km from Lahore, on Friday evening.

title: Building Opened As Orphanage In 2021, Never Used, Inaugurated Again As Hotel In Assam
content: A government building that was inaugurated as a home for orphans and destitute children four years ago in Assam's Dima Hasao district was again inaugurated this month as a hotel.

title: Poll Body Releases Draft Voter List For Bihar, Allows One Month For Claims
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) on Friday released the draft voter list for Bihar, following a month-long special intensive revision (SIR) process

title: Trump Tariffs Highlights: "Going To Prioritise Key Trading Partners," Says US On Tariff Rates
content: Donald Trump Tariff Highlights: US President Donald Trump on Friday unveiled an array of import levies that ranged as high as 41 per cent on Syria and included a hike on Canadian imports from the current 25 per cent to 35 per cent.

title: 'Mistake': Sadhvi Ritambhara Apologises For 'Earning Money Being Nude' Remark
content: After sparking outrage with her remark that she feels ashamed to see Hindu women earn money by being nude and performing dirty dances, spiritual leader Sadhvi Ritambhara has said she apologises if anyone has been hurt by her remarks,

title: "No Slum Will Be Razed Without Rehabilitation": Delhi Chief Minister
content: In a move that could pause ongoing and future slum evictions across the national capital, Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Friday ordered all agencies, including the Delhi Development Authority (DDA), Indian Railways.

title: Malayalam Actor Kalabhavan Navas Found Dead In Hotel Room
content: Malayalam film actor and mimicry artist Kalabhavan Navas was found dead in a hotel in Chottanikkaraa on Friday evening, police said.

title: Night Vision Goggles May Have Hampered Chopper Pilots Before Crash With Jet: Experts
content: The pilots of a US Army helicopter that collided with a passenger jet over Washington in January would've had difficulty spotting the plane while wearing night vision goggles, experts told the National Transportation Safety Board.

title: Bengal BJP ups ante against ‘fake’ voters, accuses Trinamool of ‘threatening’ BLOs
content: CM Mamata Banerjee has told BLOs not to harass ‘genuine’ voters. In a meeting, she told officials, “EC comes in during elections, but you all are employees of the State government”.

title: Enforcement Directorate conducts searches across five States in probe of alleged Axis Mutual Fund scam
content: ED searches in Delhi, Gujarat, Haryana, West Bengal, Punjab; Axis MF fund manager accused of exploiting confidential information to pre-emptively trade stocks, generating illicit profits of ₹200 crore

title: Sarah Joseph chosen for Kozhikode Corporation’s literary award
content: The literary award will be formally presented to Sarah Joseph at an event scheduled to be held here in mid-August

title: Upland farmers in Kozhikode seek Forest department’s intervention to strengthen rapid response team
content: Demands recently raised by a section of farmers have already been brought to the attention of the Forest department for prompt action, says local administrators from Koorachundu panchayat

title: Bihar SIR: 3.95 lakh voters not included in Patna
content: Three lakh voters missing from the draft roll in each of the three districts of East Champaran, Madhubani and Gopalganj; INDIA bloc leaders said that the Election Commission did not give any satisfactory answer to the questions raised by them

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. unveils Electronics Component Manufacturing Policy 2024–29
content: New five-year policy aims to strengthen electronics manufacturing, develop specialised clusters, and attract global players to build a robust semiconductor and display ecosystem in the State

title: August 8 last date to apply for ‘Best Teacher’ awards in Andhra Pradesh
content: School Education Department to select teachers under three categories based on self-nomination, peer recommendation, and performance via LEAP app

title: K. Arul Jothi takes charge as security chief for Southern Railway
content: During his stint as Deputy Inspector General, Southern Railway in the 2019-20 COVID-19 period, he spearheaded the RPF teams in organising the safe movement of migrant workers to various parts of the country through 503 Shramik Special Trains

title: Centre to withdraw order granting release of film Udaipur files, Delhi HC told
content: The court, which was hearing two pleas challenging the Centre’s decision allowing the release of the movie, directed the parties to appear before the government on August 4 and make their submissions.

title: M.P. High Court asks State to consider relocating burial site of toxic residue from Bhopal waste
content: Court directs government to submit plan for safe containment of incinerated residue in low seismic, uninhabited zone

title: Deletion of 65 lakh names just the beginning, says Yogendra Yadav on draft Bihar voter list
content: The political analyst urges that the Special Intensive Revision exercise should be scrapped right away

title: Mirwaiz showers rare praise on J&K MPs for highlighting ‘Kashmir plight’ in Parliament
content: During Friday prayers, he asks Centre to start ‘engagement at all levels’ as engagement at all levels is a ‘far cheaper and evolved narrative’

title: Passenger assaults co-traveller on IndiGo aircraft
content: The commotion happened as the passenger onboard Mumbai-Kolkata flight reported discomfort possibly due to a panic attack and requested to be deboarded leading to protests from others as it would cause a delay

title: No need for Karnataka to give land for cheap to IT firms: Priyank Kharge
content: The State’s IT Minister said that the government was promoting schemes to upskill talent, and that Karnataka benefited from early investments in the IT sector.

title: After Madras High Court rules on naming of ‘Ungaludan Stalin’ and ‘Nalam Kaakum Stalin’ schemes, Tamil Nadu government seeks clarification
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice Sunder Mohan accepted a request made by Advocate General P.S. Raman for an early hearing of the modification petition since the ‘Nalam Kaakum Stalin’ scheme was all set to be launched across the State on August 2

title: Encounters breaks out in J&K’s Kulgam
content: The encounter in Kashmir’s Kulgam comes just days after the security forces killed all the three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam terror attack in an encounter at Srinagar’s Dachigam area.

title: Bangladesh envoy arrives in Tripura on three-day visit
content: Bangladesh High Commissioner visits Tripura, meets officials, inspects infrastructure projects, including Agartala-Akhaura rail link and Maitri Setu

title: SI, two constables arrested under POCSO Act in 2023 dismissed from service
content: Four police personnel reached Mukkombu in a car in plainclothes and consumed liquor and they spotted a 17-year-old girl with a 19-year-old youth and threatened them

title: Draft poll roll for Bihar is out, number of voters dip by 65 lakh
content: Election Commission publishes list after end of first phase of Special Intensive Revision; Patna draft roll has 3.95 lakh fewer voters than the list from January

title: PM Modi to visit Varanasi on August 2, inaugurate many infra projects
content: PM Modi to inaugurate projects worth ₹2,200 crore in Varanasi, release PM Kisan Samman Nidhi, and address public meeting

title: Award for The Kerala Story invites a storm of criticism
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan says the jury has insulted the noble tradition of Indian cinema that stood for religious brotherhood and national integration by awarding a film that was built on lies to defame Kerala and spread communalism

title: Banakacherla: BRS blames Congress, BJP ‘silence’ for AP going ahead
content: Harish Rao suggests AP to agree for Telangana’s rightful share in Krishna, Godavari waters before seeking its nod for PBLP

title: RTC workers to go on indefinite strike from August 5
content: The JAC, which represents employees of all four State-run transport corporations, has demanded a salary hike effective from January 1, 2024, and the settlement of pending arrears for 38 months from January 1, 2020, to February 28, 2023.

title: It may take one year to get death certificate of youths killed in Russia-Ukraine war
content: 13 Indian nationals recruited by Russia as mercenaries in the war with Ukraine remain in the Russian armed forces

title: Indian Navy’s Eastern Fleet arrives in Manila to bolster Indo-Pacific ties

title: Reservoirs across Andhra Pradesh brimming, Nagarjuna Sagar is 95% full

title: Knowledge gained at ISS is going to be useful for our Gaganyaan mission: Group Captain Shukla
content: Group Captain Shukla, who is one of the four astronauts selected for the Gaganyaan mission, shares the highlights of the Ax-4 mission for the first time after returning to Earth

title: Health Minister hints at equipment going missing from Urology department

title: CM announces revival of Gandikota Festival; slated for December 26, 27

title: CPI(M) urges NIA to appeal against acquittal of Malegaon blasts case accused
content: The CPI(M) Polit Bureau says it was yet another case of undue delay and eventual denial of justice to the victims of a terrorist act by an extremist Hindutva group

title: Malayalam cinema wins four honours at National Film Awards; Urvashi and Vijayaraghavan get best supporting actor awards
content: Urvashi wins the best supporting actor (female) for her performance in Ullozhukku and Vijayaraghavan wins the award for the best supporting actor (male) for Pookkaalam, although technically both of them played the lead roles in these films

title: Chemists’ body seeks action against startups for unauthorised tampering, repacking of medicine strips
content: ‘Such tampering and repacking of medicine strips threaten patient safety, undermine ethical pharmacy practices, and erode confidence in the regulatory framework.’

title: Controversy breaks out in Maharashtra after ex-policeman claims he was asked to pick up Mohan Bhagwat over 2008 Malegaon blast case
content: Mehboob Mujawar, a former policeman who had worked in the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS), said he was pressured to arrest the RSS chief on directions from IPS officer Parambir Singh and other higher officials

title: A defensive end? Parsons asks Cowboys for trade
content: Cowboys star defensive end Micah Parsons announces in a social media post that he has requested a trade amid stalled contract extension talks.

title: 'Quality work': Hunter plays 2 ways in scrimmage
content: Rookie Travis Hunter played 38 snaps -- 17 with the first-team offense and 21 with the first-team defense -- in the Jaguars' scrimmage in front of 11,000 at EverBank Stadium.

title: Track star Richardson arrested in alleged assault
content: Sha'Carri Richardson, the reigning 100-meter world champion, was charged Sunday with fourth-degree domestic violence after an alleged incident at the Seattle-Tacoma International Airport.

title: D.C. Council approves Commanders' stadium deal
content: The Washington Commanders are going home to D.C. after the district's council voted Friday to approve a deal between the team and the city for a new stadium where its former home field -- RFK Stadium -- still stands.

title: Source: Messi bodyguard banned by Leagues Cup
content: The Leagues Cup suspended Lionel Messi's bodyguard, Yassine Cheuko, on Friday for improper conduct following an incident after the game against Atlas FC, a source told ESPN.

title: Police recover items at NYC shooter's apartment
content: Police executed a search warrant at the Las Vegas apartment of Shane Tamura, where the items obtained included a goodbye note and a bipod for a rifle.

title: C. Woods fades at Junior PGA, misses Ryder spot
content: Charlie Woods shot a 3-over 74 in the final round of the Junior PGA Championship on Friday, fading out of contention to secure one of the two qualifying spots for the U.S. Junior Ryder Cup team.

content: The new-look Twins are looking to regroup after trading away 40% of their team before the trade deadline.

content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

content: Owner Josh Harris grew up watching Washington in Super Bowls and is thrilled to renew that history with a move back to RFK.

content: After finishing 15th in the Premier League last season, Man United are still a mess and their recent transfers show they haven't wised up.

content: Chelsea's path to sign to Xavi Simons from RB Leipzig has hit a roadblock. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

content: Our FAQ guide on the latest WWE storylines, including John Cena's final SummerSlam and Jelly Roll's debut.

content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: Christian Pulisic and Puma launch 'Never Stop' cleats
content: The AC Milan star and USMNT captain teams up with Puma for a fresh drop featuring new cleats ahead of the new season.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: Week 10 preview: Key stats, players for Outlaws homecoming
content: The PLL heads to Denver, with two games for the league's top team. Here's the schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: Forecaster for Week 19: Aug 4-10
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: Risers and fallers: Fiebich trending up, Griner struggling
content: Leonie Fiebich has made the most of her increased opportunity on the Liberty, while Brittney Griner continues to have a down season.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Has India stopped buying Russian oil? Trump reacts to reports, calls it 'good step'
content: Donald Trump claimed India halted Russian oil imports, calling it a "good step," despite earlier threats of tariffs for continued trade with Russia. He also suggested Pakistan might one day sell oil to India. India's MEA firmly rejected Trump's remarks, asserting the "steady and time-tested partnership" with Russia stands independently and shouldn't be viewed through a third country's lens.

title: Did a big headload falling from a passenger lead to Delhi station stampede?
content: A stampede at New Delhi Railway Station on February 15, resulting in 18 fatalities, was triggered by a passenger's dropped headload, according to Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The incident occurred on a foot overbridge, causing a chain reaction of falling passengers. Indian Railways has disbursed ₹2 crore in compensation to victims and families.

title: Man slapped during 'panic attack' on IndiGo flight goes missing
content: A young man from Assam went missing after being slapped on an IndiGo flight from Mumbai to Kolkata, sparking outrage. Hossain Ahmed Mazumdar, possibly experiencing a panic attack, was assaulted and then disappeared after failing to board his connecting flight to Silchar.

title: 'Operation Akhal': One terrorist killed in J&K's Kulgam
content: According to officials, a joint team of the Jammu and Kashmir Police, Army and CRPF launched a cordon and search operation in the Akhal forest area of south Kashmir’s Kulgam district on Friday. The action was based on specific intelligence inputs about the presence of terrorists in the area, a police official told news agency PTI.

title: Watch: Drama! England's Pope refuses umpire's spin option, forces early stumps
content: Ollie Pope's surprising refusal to bowl spin under fading light led to an early stumps call on Day 2 of the fifth Test. Despite India's aggressive fightback and a slender lead, Pope's decision to halt play sparked debate, with England potentially sacrificing momentum. The day saw 15 wickets fall and India ending with a 52-run lead.

title: How Amazon's 'AI mistake' is lesson for every eng using Gen-AI for coding
content: An Amazon Gen-AI coding tool, Q Developer, faced a security breach where a hacker infiltrated it with malicious code disguised as a legitimate update. This allowed the hacker to instruct the tool to delete files from users' computers. The incident highlights vulnerabilities in AI-driven software development, as many organizations using AI for coding do so in risky ways.

title: Toddler survives 18-storey fall; father honours tree with red flower
content: In a miraculous turn of events, a three-year-old boy in China survived an 18-storey fall after a tree broke his descent. The incident occurred while his grandparents briefly left him unattended. After waking up, the child fell from an unprotected bathroom window.

title: Heated confrontation! Sai, Duckett in tense face-off in 5th Test - Watch
content: Tensions flared in the fifth Test between India and England as Sai Sudharsan and Ben Duckett engaged in a heated argument after Sudharsan's dismissal. This confrontation punctuated a day of high drama, featuring 15 wickets and earlier exchanges between Joe Root and Prasidh Krishna. Despite the on-field intensity, India ended the day at 75/2, leading by 52 runs.

title: J&K landslide: SDM Rajinder Singh Rana, son dead in Reasi
content: A tragic landslide in Jammu and Kashmir's Reasi district claimed the lives of Rajinder Singh, a sub-divisional magistrate, and his son. The incident occurred near Salukh Ikhter Nallah in Dharmari as the family was traveling in a Bolero vehicle. Six others were injured and are receiving treatment at District Hospital Reasi, prompting condolences from the Lieutenant Governor's office.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‘I think we have to accomplish more…’
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.

title: IND vs ENG: Historic! Siraj leaves Tendulkar behind in shock stat
content: Mohammed Siraj etched his name in Indian cricket history, surpassing Sachin Tendulkar's international wicket record. His fiery spell dismantled England's middle order in the fifth Test, claiming crucial wickets and shifting momentum. Supported by Prasidh Krishna, Siraj's performance helped India gain a crucial lead, setting the stage for a thrilling contest.

title: Dance bar row: Minister Yogesh Kadam’s family surrenders licence after raid
content: Following allegations of operating a dance bar under his mother's name, Minister Yogesh Kadam's family surrendered the orchestra license of Savali bar. MLC Anil Parab criticized the surrender, asserting it confirms Kadam's involvement in immoral activities.

title: Not a single person accepted: Murati on her team rejecting Zuckerberg’s offer
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI talent faced a significant setback as Thinking Machines Lab, led by Mira Murati, reportedly rejected lucrative offers, some reaching a billion dollars, to join Meta's Superintelligence Lab. Murati's team prioritized independence and long-term vision over substantial financial gains, highlighting the allure of shaping AI's future outside a corporate giant.

title: IND vs ENG, 5th Test: Siraj, Krishna become brothers of destruction, script new milestone
content: Day Two of the fifth Test at The Oval witnessed a dramatic collapse, with 15 wickets tumbling, the most in this series so far. England's promising start faltered against India's pace attack, led by Siraj and Krishna, who claimed four wickets each. India lost two wickets in their second innings, intensifying the pressure in this high-stakes encounter.

title: 'He wants her to feel safe': Travis Kelce shields Taylor — privacy over drama
content: Travis Kelce recently shared rare photos with Taylor Swift on social media, a move reportedly discussed with the pop star beforehand. Sources reveal Kelce prioritized Swift's comfort and privacy, ensuring she approved of the images before posting. While Kelce gears up for the NFL season and Swift remains out of the public eye, their relationship nears the two-year mark.

title: Hulk Hogan memorial service details revealed: Venue, cremation and more
content: WWE legend Hulk Hogan's memorial service is scheduled for August 5 in Tampa, following his recent death at 71 from cardiac arrest. Hogan, who battled chronic lymphocytic leukaemia, will be cremated. His ex-wife, Linda Hogan, expressed her devastation, while their daughter, Brooke Hogan, shared a heartfelt tribute, emphasizing their unbreakable bond.

title: 'He keeps his distance': Travis Kelce saw Blake Lively drama coming — trouble for Taylor Swift
content: Amid Blake Lively's legal issues involving Justin Baldoni, Travis Kelce has remained a supportive presence for Taylor Swift. Kelce, reportedly wary of Ryan Reynolds' "Hollywood" persona, has always prioritized Swift's well-being. The couples, once frequently seen together, have seemingly distanced themselves, with Lively and Reynolds absent from the recent Super Bowl, signaling a potential shift in Swift's friendships.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ Box Office day 15: Ahaan Panday-Aneet Padda’s film maintains hold; mints over Rs 4 cr
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's romantic drama 'Saiyaara' continues its successful run, grossing Rs 284.75 crore in 15 days. Despite new releases like 'Son of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' entering the competition, 'Saiyaara' maintains steady occupancy. The film now eyes the Rs 300 crore milestone, with weekend performance being crucial for achieving this target.

title: India in, China out: Majority of iPhones sold in the US from India, says Apple CEO Cook
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook confirmed that the majority of iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were manufactured in India, while China primarily serves non-US markets. Despite Trump's push for domestic production, Apple is bullish on India, witnessing record revenue growth driven by iPhone sales and planning retail expansion.

title: 'I no longer want to be here': Micah Parsons confirms trade — emotional goodbye to Dallas
content: Star linebacker Micah Parsons has requested a trade from the Dallas Cowboys, citing unmet contract demands. In a message posted on X, Parsons expressed his desire to leave after feeling the team ignored his agent's attempts to negotiate a new deal, despite initial talks with owner Jerry Jones. The Cowboys have yet to comment on the trade request.

title: Shannon Sharpe lawsuit: $50M claim questioned — payout reportedly far lower in OnlyFans case
content: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe settled a lawsuit with a 20-year-old OnlyFans model. The model initially sued Sharpe for $50 million, alleging sexual assault. Sources indicate Sharpe paid $23 million to resolve the case. Both parties acknowledge a consensual relationship. The model's lawyer confirmed a mutually agreed resolution. Sharpe has not commented publicly on the settlement. He continues his podcast work.

title: Micah Parsons’ message: 'One Last Time' GIF sparks buzz — Cowboys contract standoff deepens
content: Dallas Cowboys' star linebacker Micah Parsons is in a contract dispute with team owner Jerry Jones, sparking trade rumors. Parsons, seeking a deal similar to T.J. Watt, hinted at a potential departure if his demands aren't met. While expressing his desire to stay, Parsons acknowledged the front office's decision-making power.

title: 'Like Beyoncé but…': Taylor Heise engaged to Parker Fox — lakeside proposal goes viral
content: Taylor Heise, a professional women's hockey star, got engaged to Parker Fox. The proposal took place on June 28, 2025, at White Bear Yacht Club. Heise shared a video of the special moment on Instagram. The couple celebrated their second anniversary in February 2025. They shared photos of their time together. The engagement photos show the couple's joy and excitement.

title: 'It makes it hard': Gabrielle Union opens up — menopause, motherhood, and exhaustion
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: War of words: Trump deploys 2 nuclear subs over 'provocative' remarks by ex-Russian prez
content: Donald Trump ordered the deployment of two nuclear submarines to unspecified locations following a heated exchange with Dmitry Medvedev. The spat originated after Trump criticized Medvedev and imposed trade penalties on India for its ties with Russia. Medvedev responded with a provocative statement referencing Russia's Cold War nuclear strategy, prompting Trump's strong reaction and concerns about unintended consequences.

title: Comedy Khiladigalu fame Chandrashekhar Siddhi dies by suicide at 28
content: Chandrashekhar Siddhi, a 28-year-old comedian known for Comedy Khiladigalu Season 3, tragically died by suicide. He was found in a forest near Yellapur taluk, with police investigating the case. Siddhi, a Ninasam Theatre Institute alumnus, faced financial struggles and depression due to limited opportunities after his initial success, leading him to work as a daily wage labourer.

title: US Presidential Fitness Test: These athletes are backing Trump’s school fitness campaign? Find out
content: Donald Trump, the US President, revived the Presidential Fitness Test. This test was once a regular part of American schools. It measures kids' fitness through activities like running and sit-ups. The program started in 1966 but stopped during Obama's time. Trump also formed a sports council with famous athletes. They will set the standards for the Presidential Fitness Award. Read below!

title: 'Fire vs lamp': China torches US for hypocrisy over trade with Russia
content: China has strongly refuted US accusations of supporting Russia's war efforts in Ukraine, labeling the claims as hypocritical. A Chinese representative at the UN criticized the US for its double standards, questioning why Washington can trade with Russia while restricting others. China maintains it hasn't provided lethal weapons and urged the US to cease blame-shifting and focus on ending the conflict.

title: IND vs ENG 5th Test: Mohammed Siraj - The Last Man Standing
content: In a series where bowlers from both teams have been rotated, managed, and preserved, Mohammed Siraj has been the exception, running in hard every single time. On Friday, under a gloomy London sky, he brought India back with his lion-hearted effort and never-give-up attitude, something that, in the years to come, will be celebrated even more than his trademark “Celebrappeal,” remembered instead for his heart.

content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood. title: 2K Games details gameplay changes for NBA 2K26
content: the ProPLAY Motion Engine has overhauled how players move on the court . the engine will reduce the phenomenon of players "skating" over the floor . this also includes a new collision system that aims to be more reliable than motion capture animations used previously .
